intro: Phrynium pubinerve, commonly known as the hairy nerve plant, is a tropical flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Araceae family, characterized by its distinctive inflorescence composed of a spadix and a spathe. The plant features broad, heart-shaped leaves with a hairy texture on the underside, giving it its common name. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Phrynium pubinerve is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
